p: HR1 and HR2 are composed of a repetitive heptapeptide: HPPHCPC, where H is a hydrophobic or traditionally bulky residue, P is a polar or hydrophilic residue, and C is another charged residue [ 24]. HR1 and HR2 form the six-helical bundle (6-HB) (Fig.Â 2e), which is essential for the viral fusion and entry function of the S2 subunit [ 13]. HR1 is located at the C-terminus of a hydrophobic FP, and HR2 is located at the N-terminus of the TM domain [ 25]. The downstream TM domain anchors the S protein to the viral membrane, and the S2 subunit ends in a CT tail [ 14].
